name: JFrogCollectIssues
description: Collect build issues from the git commit messages of the project and add them to the build-info.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: artifactoryConnection
inputs.label: Artifactory service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory service to be used by this task.

inputs.name: configSource
inputs.label: Config source
inputs.helpMarkDown: To collect build issues, you need to provide a config file. To read more about the issues-collection yaml schema click here.

inputs.name: taskConfig
inputs.label: Issues collection configuration
inputs.defaultValue:
version: 1
issues:
    trackerName: JIRA
    regexp: (.+-[0-9]+)\s-\s(.+) 
    keyGroupIndex: 1
    summaryGroupIndex: 2
    trackerUrl: <REPLACE ME>
    aggregate: true
    aggregationStatus: RELEASED
inputs.helpMarkDown: To specify the details required for the build issues collection, please create a yaml configuration as described <a href="https://github.com/jfrog/jfrog-azure-devops-extension#JFrog-Collect-Build-Issues" target="_blank">here.

inputs.name: file
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a file, with the details required for the build issues collection. Please create a yaml configuration as described <a href="https://github.com/jfrog/jfrog-azure-devops-extension#JFrog-Collect-Build-Issues" target="_blank">here.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory where the command will run. When empty, the value of '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)' is used.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The collected build-info should be published to Artifactory using the 'JFrog Publish Build Info' task.
